actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to authorize the transmission, without cost to the sender, of letter mail to the President or Vice President of the United States or to Members of Congress.

summary.text: Authorizes the mailing of letter mail at no cost to the sender if mailed by a citizen to the President or to the Members of Congress from such citizen's State. Requires the Secretary of the Treasury to transfer to the Postal Service the amount of postage due for letter mail sent under this Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to authorize the transmission, without cost to the sender, of letter mail to the President or Vice President of the United States or to Members of Congress.
